Approximately 9: of the stimulus bill is allocated for COVID-19 relief, specifically for vaccine distribution, medical equipment, and other health resources to combat the virus.
The 9: figure does not include measures such as stimulus checks, unemployment benefits, funding for schools, or other forms of relief for those impacted by COVID-19.
The claim that only 9: of the American Rescue Plan is going to COVID relief is largely false, as the majority of the bill aims to provide financial relief to individuals, businesses, and governments affected by the pandemic.
While the 9: allocation for fighting the virus directly may seem low, it does not account for the significant funds dedicated to providing relief and support to those affected by the pandemic.
